intro: Sieglingia congesta, commonly known as the clustered Sieglingia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sieglingia congesta is often found in open woodlands and along the edges of grasslands.
